How to Install artemis on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • artemis

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install artemis on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing artemis on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall artemis in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install artemis, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install artemis Using apt

To install artemis in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install artemis using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install artemis

The installation of artemis might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install artemis Using apt-get

To install artemis using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install artemis.

sudo apt-get -y install artemis

Install artemis Using Synaptic

To install artemis using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install artemis on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for artemis. This will display the artemis package in the package window, now to install artemis, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the artemis package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of artemis.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install artemis Using aptitude

To install artemis on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of artemis.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install artemis using the command aptitude install artemis.

sudo aptitude -y install artemis

How to Upgrade artemis on debian

If you want to upgrade the artemis package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade artemis using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade artemis to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade artemis.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade artemis sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade artemis

Upgrade artemis using Aptitude

To upgrade artemis using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade artemis.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade artemis

Upgrade artemis using Synaptic

To upgrade artemis using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for artemis, now right-click artemis, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade artemis just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall artemis on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall artemis from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just artemis, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove artemis

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of artemis

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of artemis you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge artemis

Remove artemis using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall artemis using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for artemis, right-click the artemis package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall artemis click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install artemis on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade artemis using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of artemis then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
